newsitem.title: USA: STAC to incur charge in Sept 1997 quarter.
newsitem.headline: STAC to incur charge in Sept 1997 quarter.

text.p: Stac Inc said during the September 1997 quarter, the company expects to incur a charge of about $750,000, or $0.02 per share, in connection with the reorganization of its sales and marketing departments.

Research and development expenses for the June 1997 quarter increased to $3,002,000 from $2,132,000 a year earlier due to the addition of development personnel to support the ReachOut, Replica and Hi/fn product lines.
The company expects to continue to spend significant amounts on the development of the Replica product line and on Hi/fn's coprocessor products.
Sales and marketing expenses for the June 1997 quarter were $4,714,000 versus $3,402,000 in the year earlier quarter.
The increase in sales and marketing expenses was the result of the addition of personnel and program costs intended to create end user demand for the Company's products.

The company plans to focus its sales and marketing efforts on its primary customer profile and, as a result, expects its sales and marketing expenses to decrease in the September 1997 quarter. General and administrative expenses in the June 1997 quarter were $1,385,000 compared with $1,016,000 in the year earlier quarter.
